info.title: Adobe Photoshop and Imaging APIs
info.description: Your interface to Adobe Photoshop and Imaging APIs

/sensei/status/{jobID}.summary: Get the status for an asynchronous cutout/mask job

parameters.name: jobID
parameters.description: The job to get status for

/sensei/cutout.summary: Initiate an asynchronous job to generate a PNG file in 4 channel RGBA format with the generated cutout mask applied to the input image

/sensei/mask.summary: Initiate an asynchronous job to generate a mask PNG

/lrService/status/{jobID}.summary: Get the status for an asynchronous Lightroom job

parameters.name: jobID
parameters.description: The job to get status for

/lrService/autoStraighten.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to auto straighten an image

/lrService/autoTone.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to auto tone an image

/lrService/edit.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to apply a set of edit parameters on an image

/lrService/presets.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to apply a preset on an image

/lrService/xmp.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to apply an XMP setting to an image

/pie/psdService/status/{jobId}.summary: Returns status and layer info for a psd file created by POST /psdService/status. Will return 202 as long as there are child jobs still running and 200 once all children are complete

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The job to get status for

202.description: as long as there are child jobs still running

/pie/psdService/documentManifest.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to extract and return a psd file's layer information

/pie/psdService/documentCreate.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to create a new psd, optionally with layers, and then generate renditions and/or save as a psd

/pie/psdService/documentOperations.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to apply (optional) psd edits and then generate renditions and/or save as a new psd

/pie/psdService/renditionCreate.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to create renditions

/pie/psdService/smartObject.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to apply psd edits for replacing embedded smart object and then generate renditions and/or save a new psd

/pie/psdService/photoshopActions.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to play Photoshop Actions and then generate renditions and/or save as a new image

/pie/psdService/actionJSON.summary: Initiates an asynchronous job to play JSON-formatted Photoshop Actions and then generate renditions and/or save as a new image

x-gw-ims-org-id.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
x-gw-ims-org-id.description: IMS organization ID. This needs to be sent only if it is desirable to receive the job status through Adobe I/O Events

input.description: File on Adobe's cloud or an external service (like AWS S3, Azure, Dropbox)

href.description:
Either an href to a single Creative Cloud asset for storage='adobe' OR a presigned GET URL for other external services.

* CC Storage path must be prepended with `/files` or `/cloud-content` or `/assets`
* The `/files` path directly corresponds to the root of your local `Creative Cloud Files` folder
* The `/cloud-content` path directly corresponds to the root of your `Cloud Documents` folder in CC
* The `/assets` path directly corresponds to the specific sync-group section of CC storage

Either an href to a single Creative Cloud asset for storage='adobe' OR a presigned GET URL for other external services.

* CC Storage path must be prepended with `/files` or `/cloud-content` or `/assets`
* The `/files` path directly corresponds to the root of your local `Creative Cloud Files` folder
* The `/cloud-content` path directly corresponds to the root of your `Cloud Documents` folder in CC
* The `/assets` path directly corresponds to the specific sync-group section of CC storage

overwrite.description: If the file already exists, indicates if the output file should be overwritten. Will eventually support eTags. Only applies to CC Storage

href.description:
Either a Creative Cloud assets path for storage='adobe' OR a presignedPutURL

* CC Storage hrefs
  * Must be prepended with `/files` or `/cloud-content` or `/asset`
  * The `/files` path directly corresponds to the root of your local `Creative Cloud Files` folder
  * The `/cloud-content` path directly corresponds to the root of your `Cloud documents` folder in CC
* Template Tokens: At runtime these two tokens get replaced with their respective values... (FOR "adobe" STORED FOLDERS ONLY)
  * $ReqID - replaced with the request id generated by the service
  * $FileName - replaced with the folder name
* If the output path is a folder than the Template Tokens will be used to dynamically generate the output file name according to the pattern "/files/<path>/$ReqID_$FileName.<ext>"

overwrite.description: If the file already exists, indicates if the output file should be overwritten. Will eventually support eTags. Only applies to CC Storage

jobId.description: the job's id requested (tbd. different case from Sensei?)

errorDetails.description: Description of the exact error that is reported by the requested job. Will appear in the response only if there is an error.

outputs.description: Only a single output is supported currently

inputs.description: A hash describing an input image to edit. The input object will be one of 'external', 'adobe', 'azure' or 'dropbox'

presets.description: An array describing the list of presets to apply. The preset objects will either be one of 'external', 'adobe', 'azure' or 'dropbox'

profileName.description: the name of the color profile

photoshopOutputLayers.description:
An array of layer objects.
By including this array you are signaling that you'd like a rendition created from these layer id's or layer names. Excluding it will generate a document-level rendition.

href.description:
Either a Creative Cloud assets path for storage='adobe' OR a presignedPutURL

* CC Storage hrefs
  * Must be prepended with `/files` or `/cloud-content` or `/asset`
  * The `/files` path directly corresponds to the root of your local `Creative Cloud Files` folder
  * The `/cloud-content` path directly corresponds to the root of your `Cloud documents` folder in CC
* Template Tokens: At runtime these two tokens get replaced with their respective values... (FOR "adobe" STORED FOLDERS ONLY)
  * $ReqID - replaced with the request id generated by the service
  * $FileName - replaced with the folder name
* If the output path is a folder than the Template Tokens will be used to dynamically generate the output file name according to the pattern "/files/<path>/$ReqID_$FileName.<ext>"

type.description:
desired image format

* image/vnd.adobe.photoshop - Create a new PSD file
* image/jpeg, image/png, image/tiff - Create a new jpeg, png or tiff rendition

Image mode conversions:

Certain image modes (rgb, cmyk, greyscale, etc) must be converted to another image mode before a rendition can be created:

* Tiff Requested: Multichannel and Duotone will convert to RGB
* PNG Requested: CMYK, HSL, HSB, Multichannel, Duotone, Lab and XYZ will convert to RGB

overwrite.description: If the file already exists, indicates if the output file should be overwritten. Will eventually support eTags. Only applies to CC Storage

width.description: width, in pixels, of the renditions. Width of 0 generates a full size rendition. Height is not necessary as the rendition generate will automatically figure out the correct width-to-height aspect ratio. Only supported for image rendition

quality.description: quality of the renditions for JPEG. Range from 1 to 7, with 7 as the highest quality.

compression.description: compression level for PNG: small, medium or large.

trimToCanvas.description: 'false' generates renditions that are the actual size of the layer (as seen by View > Show > Layer Edges within the Photoshop desktop app) but will remove any extra transparent pixel padding. 'true' generates renditions that are the size of the canvas, either trimming the layer to the visible portion of the canvas or padding extra space. If the requested file format supports transparency than transparent pixels will be used for padding, otherwise white pixels will be used.

width.description: the requested rendition width in pixels

status.description:
the child job status
* pending - request has been accepted and is waiting to start
* running - the child job is running
* uploading - files have been generated and are uploading to destination
* succeeded - the child job has succeeded
* failed - the child job has failed

options.description: available options to apply to all input files

thumbnails.description: Include presigned GET URLs to small preview thumbnails for any renderable layer

layerEdit.description: Indicates you want to edit the layer identified by it's id or name. Note the object is currently empty but leaves room for further enhancements. The layer block should than contain changes from the original manifest. If you apply it to a group layer you will be effecting the attributes of the group layer itself, not the child layers. Edit layer is supported for layer type "smartObject" and "fillLayer" only.

id.description: The id of the layer you want to insert above. Use either id OR name.

name.description: The name of the layer you want to insert above. Use either id OR name.

manageMissingFonts.description:
action to take if there are one or more missing fonts in the document

* fail - The job will not succeed and the status will be set to "failed", with the details of the error provided in the "details" section in the status
* useDefault - The job will succeed, however, by default all the missing fonts will be replaced with this font: ArialMT

globalFont.description:
options.globalFont The full postscript name of the font to be used as the global default for the document. This font will be used for any text layer which has a missing font and no other font has been specifically provided for that layer.
If this font itself is missing, the option specified for manageMissingFonts from above will take effect.

type.description:
the layer type.

* smartObject - a smart object
* fillLayer - a fill layer

smartObject.description:
An object describing the attributes specific to creating or editing a smartObject.
SmartObject properties need the input smart object file to operate on, which can be obtained from Input block. Currently we support Embedded Smart Object only.So this block is optional. If you are creating a Linked Smart Object, this is a required block.

linked.description: Indicates if this Smart Object is linked. Currently we support Embedded Smart Object only which means "linked = false".

horizontalAlign.description: Indicates the horizontal position where this layer needs to be placed at. Applicable only to layer type="smartObject" or layer type="layer".

verticalAlign.description: Indicates the vertical position where this layer needs to be placed at. Applicable only to layer type="smartObject" or layer type="layer".

manageMissingFonts.description:
action to take if there are one or more missing fonts in the document

* fail - The job will not succeed and the status will be set to "failed", with the details of the error provided in the "details" section in the status
* useDefault - The job will succeed, however, by default all the missing fonts will be replaced with this font: ArialMT

globalFont.description:
options.globalFont The full postscript name of the font to be used as the global default for the document. This font will be used for any text layer which has a missing font and no other font has been specifically provided for that layer.
If this font itself is missing, the option specified for manageMissingFonts from above will take effect.

delete.description: Indicates you want to delete the layer, including any children, identified by the id or name. Note the object is currently empty but leaves room for further enhancements

index.description: the layer index.  Required when deleting a layer, otherwise not used

type.description:
the layer type.

* smartObject - a smart object
* fillLayer - a fill layer

smartObject.description:
An object describing the attributes specific to creating or editing a smartObject.
SmartObject properties need the input smart object file to operate on, which can be obtained from Input block. Currently we support Embedded Smart Object only.So this block is optional. If you are creating a Linked Smart Object, this is a required block.

linked.description: Indicates if this Smart Object is linked. Currently we support Embedded Smart Object only which means "linked = false".

inputs.description: An array of input objects. We currently only support one input object
An array of input objects. We currently only support one input object
An array of input objects. We currently only support one input object
An array of input objects. We currently only support one input object

photoshopBuild.description: the name of the application that created the PSD

layers.description: a tree of layer objects representing the PSD layer structure extracted from the psd document

id.description: the layer id. Note an id of -1 is valid and indicates a PSD that only contains a background image and no layers

thumbnail.description: If thumbnails were requested, a presigned GET URL to the thumbnail

type.description:
the layer type

* layer - a pixel layer
* textLayer - a text layer
* adjustmentLayer - an adjustment layer
* layerSection - a grouping layer
* smartObject - a smart object
* backgroundLayer - a background layer
* fillLayer - a fill layer

fonts.description: array of custom fonts needed in this document

brushes.description: array of custom brushes needed in this document

actions.description: array of Photoshop Actions to play

action.description: An object describing the input Photoshop Actions to play.

href.description: Either a Creative Cloud assets path for storage="adobe" OR a presignedGETURL

patterns.description: array of custom pattern preset to be used in Photoshop Actions

options_asset.description: An object describing the input custom font, brush or pattern.

href.description: Either a Creative Cloud assets path for storage="adobe" OR a presigned GET URL

actions_json.description: array of Photoshop JSON-formatted Actions to play

action_json.description: An object describing a single Photoshop Actions JSON command.

additional_images.description: array of references to additional images, which can be referred by actionJson commands

channels.description: an array of hashes representing the 'master' channel (the remaining five channels of 'magentas', 'yellows', 'greens', etc are not yet supported)

layerMask.description: An object describing the input mask added or replaced to the layer

clip.description: Indicates if this is a clipped layer

enabled.description: Indicates a mask is enabled on that layer or not

linked.description: Indicates a mask is linked to the layer or not

x.description: Offset to indicate horizontal move of the mask

y.description: Offset to indicate vertical move of the mask

type.description: Desired image format for the smart object

linked.description: Indicates if this Smart Object is linked. Currently we support Embedded Smart Object only which means "linked = false"

name.description: Name of the embedded or linked smart object. Currently we support Embedded Smart Object only

path.description: Attribute for only Linked Smart Object. Indicates the relative path for the Linked Smart Object

rgb.description: An object describing the rgb color format in 8 bits

fontColorRgb.description: An object describing the rgb color format in 16 bits

fontColorCmyk.description: the font color settings for cmyk mode in 16bit representation

fontColorGray.description: the font color settings for gray mode in 16bit representation

fontColorLab.description: the font color settings for lab mode in 16bit representation.

characterStyles.description: characterStyle settings. If the same supported attributes apply to all characters in the layer than this will be an array of one item, otherwise each characterStyle object will have a 'from' and 'to' value indicating the range of characters that the style applies to.

paragraphStyles.description: paragraphStyles settings. If the same supported attributes apply to all characters in the layer than this will be an array of one item, otherwise each paragraphStyle object will have a 'from' and 'to' value indicating the range of characters that the style applies to.

from.description: The beginning of the range of characters that this characterStyle applies to. Based on initial index of 0. For example a style applied to only the first two characters would be from=0 and to=1

to.description: The ending of the range of characters that this characterStyle applies to. Based on initial index of 0. For example a style applied to only the first two characters would be from=0 and to=1

fontName.description: the font's postscript name. The list of supported fonts is at https://github.com/AdobeDocs/photoshop-api-docs/blob/master/SupportedFonts.md

paragraphStyle.description: If the same supported attributes apply to all characters in the layer than this will be an array of one item, otherwise each paragraphStyle object will have a 'from' and 'to' value indicating the range of characters that the style applies to.

from.description: The beginning of the range of characters that this paragraphStyle applies to. Based on initial index of 0. For example a style applied to only the first two characters would be from=0 and to=1

to.description: The ending of the range of characters that this paragraphStyle applies to. Based on initial index of 0. For example a style applied to only the first two characters would be from=0 and to=1

blendOptions.description: Blend options of a layer, including opacity and blend mode

opacity.description: Indicates the opacity value of a layer
